perturbation.original_text: All material submitted to Distributor will be provided by Distributor to S2K with comments or approval no later than three business days after receipt in AdLit.
perturbation.changed_text: All material submitted to Distributor will be provided by Distributor to S2K with comments or approval no later than ten business days after receipt in AdLit.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the review period for marketing materials from three business days to ten business days. FINRA Rule 2210(c)(2)(A) requires firms to have reasonable procedures for reviewing communications to ensure they are fair, balanced, and not misleading. While FINRA doesn't prescribe a specific review timeline, a ten-business-day delay could be deemed unreasonable, especially in a rapidly changing market, potentially hindering timely and compliant communication with the public.

perturbation.original_text:
If S2K wishes Distributor to perform an expedited review of marketing pieces within one business day of Distributor' receipt of such marketing pieces, the expedited review will be performed subject to and in accordance with the following:
a) A charge of $250 will apply to each request for expedited review, in addition to FINRA filing fees.
perturbation.changed_text:
If S2K wishes Distributor to perform an expedited review of marketing pieces within five business days of Distributor' receipt of such marketing pieces, the expedited review will be performed subject to and in accordance with the following:
a) A charge of $50 will apply to each request for expedited review, in addition to FINRA filing fees.
perturbation.explanation: This change modifies the terms for expedited review, increasing the review period to five business days while significantly decreasing the charge for the expedited review. FINRA Rule 2210(c)(2)(A) requires firms to have reasonable procedures for reviewing communications. Although the change would not directly contradict the rule, the new review timeline of five business days for an 'expedited' review may be considered unreasonable under the FINRA regulation, especially if this longer period could hinder timely and compliant communication with the public or cause misleading communications to be released.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall end on the 60th day following a written notice from one party to the other of its decision to terminate this Agreement at the end of such 60-day period or upon termination of the applicable Distribution Agreement with respect to a Fund.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall end on the 10th day following a written notice from one party to the other of its decision to terminate this Agreement at the end of such 10-day period or upon termination of the applicable Distribution Agreement with respect to a Fund.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the termination notice period to 10 days could be problematic under general contract law principles. While not directly violating a specific statute, such a short notice period may be deemed unreasonable, particularly given the complexity of the agreement and the potential disruption to the involved parties. A court might find that 10 days does not allow sufficient time to wind down operations, transition responsibilities, or secure alternative arrangements, potentially rendering the termination clause unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles related to reasonable notice.
